intro: Achimenes longiflora var. ilicifolia, commonly known as the silky achimenes, is a tropical perennial plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in warm, humid environments with bright indirect light. It is often cultivated as a ornamental plant for its vibrant blooms and trailing habit. The variety ilicifolia is distinguished by its finely hairy stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive, silky appearance.
